Ask yourself how bad the trigger itself really is and react in proportion to the trigger. Then you can address whatever priming caused the overreaction that you were experiencing in regard to the trigger

When things do go awry, try to react in proportion to the trigger itself, without any amplification by the priming. Try to imagine how you would react if the trigger were happening for the first time (and in isolation)

Usually, most of the anger that we experience in relation to an event that sparked it has actually been fueled by the priming (whatever has frustrated us in the past) and is out of proportion to trigger itself
